en.title: What can you edit?

capabilities.title: Add & Remove Elements
capabilities.description: Add or remove objects while matching the original style, lighting, and perspective
examples: Add a small knitted wizard hat on my cat's head, make it look comfortable
Remove the person in the background and fill with matching scenery
Add sunglasses to the person in the photo, matching the lighting

capabilities.title: Semantic Masking
capabilities.description: Edit specific parts of an image without modifying the rest
examples: Change only the blue sofa to a vintage brown leather chesterfield, keep everything else
Replace the red car with a white Tesla Model 3, maintain the same angle and lighting
Change the wall color from white to sage green, keep furniture unchanged

capabilities.title: Style Transfer
capabilities.description: Transform your image into different artistic styles
examples: Transform this photo into Van Gogh's 'Starry Night' style with swirling brushstrokes
Convert this portrait to anime style with vibrant colors and bold outlines
Apply watercolor painting effect while preserving the composition

capabilities.title: Background Changes
examples: Change the background to a sunset beach with warm color grading
Replace the indoor background with a professional studio setup
Add a blurred bokeh effect to the background, keep subject sharp

capabilities.title: Color Grading
examples: Apply cinematic color grading with teal and orange tones
Make the image warmer with golden hour lighting
Convert to black and white with high contrast

capabilities.title: Quality Enhancement
examples: Enhance the image quality and add more details
Improve lighting and make colors more vibrant
Sharpen the image and reduce noise

tips.title: Tips for better edits
items: Be specific about what to change and what to keep
Describe the desired style, lighting, and mood
Mention if you want to preserve certain elements
Use 'only' or 'just' to limit changes to specific areas
Describe the final result you want to achieve

en.note: The AI automatically upscales images to higher resolution (up to 1024x1024 or larger depending on aspect ratio)
